articles.description: Former Wales rugby star Louis Rees-Zammit joins back-to-back Super Bowl champions the Kansas City Chiefs.
articles.title: Louis Rees-Zammit: Former Wales rugby union wing lands NFL contract with Kansas City Chiefs

articles.description: Victor Wembanyama hits a career-high 40 points as the San Antonio Spurs hold off the New York Knicks.
articles.title: NBA: Victor Wembanyama scores career-high 40 points in San Antonio Spurs victory

articles.description: Xabi Alonso "felt the time was right" to end speculation over his future by announcing he will stay at Bayer Leverkusen, writes Guillem Balague.
articles.title: 'Alonso feels time is right to end speculation'

articles.description: BBC Sport columnist Guillem Balague discusses the similarities between Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola and Arsenal counterpart Mikel Arteta.
articles.title: 'Master and pupil' - how Arteta and Guardiola compare

articles.description: Jannik Sinner needs only 69 minutes to breeze past defending champion Daniil Medvedev and reach the Miami Open final.
articles.title: Miami Open: Jannik Sinner thrashes Daniil Medvedev to reach final

articles.description: Chelsea manager Mauricio Pochettino says his side "should be in fourth position" according to "all the data".
articles.title: Chelsea 'should be fourth' says Pochettino

articles.description: England host Wales at Ashton Gate in what is anticipated to be the largest home crowd for a fixture not played at Twickenham for the Red Roses.
articles.title: England tinkering before visit of positive Wales

articles.description: Bayer Leverkusen boss Xabi Alonso says it is "the right place" for him as he confirms he will remain at the club next season despite interest from Liverpool and Bayern Munich.
articles.title: Bayer Leverkusen is right place for me to be - Alonso

articles.description: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag says he does not care about speculation surrounding his job.
articles.title: Ten Hag 'doesn't care' about Man Utd job speculation

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says Sunday's opponents and title rivals Manchester City have "raised the bar to levels not seen before".
articles.title: Man City level 'not seen before in football' - Arteta
